title: 113_hr5243
content: The "Let Seniors Work Act of 2014" eliminates payroll tax for individuals who have reached retirement age, reducing the contribution and benefit base to zero for those individuals starting in 2014. The "Let Seniors Work Act of 2014" eliminates deductions on account of work. The "Let Seniors Work Act of 2014" repeals certain sections of the Social Security Act and makes conforming amendments to section 203. The "Let Seniors Work Act of 2014" repeals sections of the Social Security Act and makes amendments to section 203, including redesignating subsections and updating references. SEC. 4. ADDITIONAL CONFORMING AMENDMENTS. Provisions in the Social Security Act are amended to adjust benefits termination upon deportation, exemptions from reductions based on early retirement, and exemptions from reductions based on disregard of certain entitlements to child's insurance benefits. Amendments are made to sections of the Social Security Act regarding entitlements to child's insurance benefits, suspension of aliens' benefits, and reductions in benefits based on maximum benefits. Amendments are made to sections of the Social Security Act regarding penalties for misrepresentations concerning earnings, provisions relating to deductions from benefits on account of work, and taking into account earnings in determining benefit computation years. Amendments are made to various sections of the Social Security Act, including provisions relating to rounding of benefits, earnings taken into account for blind individuals, and defining income for SSI purposes. Amendments to the Social Security Act include redefining the term 'wages' for paragraph (1)(A) to align with section 209 definitions, excluding certain limitations on remuneration amounts. Services not considered employment under section 210 are deemed as such if the remuneration is not included in the individual's net income calculation. The curr_chunk discusses the exclusion of certain payments from an individual's net earnings for self-employment under title II. It also mentions the repeal of deductions on account of work under the Railroad Retirement Program. The curr_chunk amends certain subsections of the Railroad Retirement Act of 1974, including the removal of subsection (f) and redesignation of subsection (g)(1) as subsection (g). Conforming amendments are also made to sections 3(f)(1) and 4(g)(2) of the Act. The curr_chunk discusses deductions under section 2(g) of the Act. The amendments and repeals made by sections 3 and 4 of this Act will apply to taxable years ending on or after the enactment date of this Act.
